title: HF Holidays roams far in latest brochure
text:
HF Holidays roams far in latest brochure 3 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
The Himalayas and an itinerary covering Britain’s most north westerly point have been added to HF Holidays’ walking and outdoor programme. 
They are just two of the six sections that the operator has added to the 2016 programme with New Mexico and Colorado, Cape Verde, the Lisbon Coast and La Gomera in Spain all making their debuts. 
The new 16-day guided Indian Himalaya tour takes a route through the tea plantations set against the backdrop of the mountain range. 
Departures are on March 13, October 3 and November 7 next year and are from £2,659pp excluding flights. 
The price includes full-board en-suite accommodation, internal flights and walking and sightseeing excursions. 
HF’s Cape Wrath Classic is a guided tour of one of Scotland’s most remote regions (above). The terrain is described as “exceptionally remote” and includes an ascent of Ben Stack and a visit to Sandwood Bay. The seven-night package is offered on August 3 and September 21, from £949pp full board. 
Also new in the 2015-16 Walking and Outdoor Holidays preview brochure are New Mexico and Colorado, Cape Verde, La Gomera and the Lisbon coast.
